DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Spleen Anatomic Site Administered Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not radiation therapy was administered on the spleen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Spleen Anatomic Site Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation. _An organ that is part of the hematopoietic and immune systems.  It is composed of the white pulp and the red pulp and is surrounded by a capsule.  It is located in the left hypochondriac region.  Its functions include lymphocyte production, blood cell storage, and blood cell destruction._Named locations of or within the body._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: An organ that is part of the lymphatic system. The spleen produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys old blood cells. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach.:Named locations of, or within, the body.:Given.

Concepts.definition: An organ that is part of the hematopoietic and immune systems. It is composed of the white pulp and the red pulp and is surrounded by a capsule. It is located in the left hypochondriac region. Its functions include lymphocyte production, blood cell storage, and blood cell destruction.
Named locations of or within the body.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
